text:
Hello there, I do have an issue with global theme settings. I switched my font for h1 from roboto to verdena, then saved and published the theme changes to100+ assets. When I check my live pages they still use the old rules. Only in preview mode I see the changes. The only way I found to set the changes live is by updating the page induvidually. Is there a global way to set theme setting changes live to all pages?
And how is this possible? Do we have two different main.css files? One on a page or one on the theme level? The font is defined in the _typography.css font-family:
```{{ theme.typography.h1.props.font_style.font }};```
Thank you for your answers

Hello everyone :slightly_smiling_face: I have a problem with react application on HubSpot template: I can't see content of my react app when I put it on my website (this website contains HubSpot modules and my custom modules), but I can see react app content when I put application module on an empty template. Has anyone had a similar problem?  Why does the react module not show the content when I insert it into the finished page?
Hi <@U03J8LLBSTE> - what do you mean by empty template?

<@U03CH3JFK7T> - I just had a PR get merged this week on the CMS-React-Boilerplate. It had been neglected and therefore had a few issues with an out dated package causing install issues.

But it should be all good now as a great starting point add a react module to a HubSpot page/theme
